text: Tatiana Yakovlevna Zatulovskaya ( , ) (8 December 1935 – 2 July 2017) was an Israeli (formerly Soviet and Russian) chess player. She held the title of Woman Grandmaster (WGM) and was twice women's senior world champion. Her last name may also be spelled as Zatulovskaia or Zatulovskaja. Zatulovskaya was a three-time winner of the Women's Soviet Chess Championship (1960, 1962, and 1963). ==Career== In 1961, she was awarded by FIDE the title of Woman International Master (WIM). In 1976, Zatulovskaya became a Woman Grandmaster. She represented the USSR at the 1963 and 1966 Women's Chess Olympiads. In the 1960s and the 1970s she often qualified for Interzonals and Candidates Tournaments for the Women's World Chess Championship. In 1993, she won the Women's Seniors World Championship with 10 out of 11 points (10 wins, 0 losses, and 2 draws). In 1997, she became again the World Champion among senior women. In 2000, she emigrated to Israel. As of April 2009, Zatulovskaya's rating was 2034. ==Death== Zatulovskaya was born in Baku. She died of liver failure in Tel Aviv at the age of 81.Ушла из жизни Татьяна Яковлевна Затуловская (1935-2017) == References == ==Other websites== Category:1935 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Azerbaijani chess players Category:Jewish Israeli sportspeople Category:Naturalized citizens of Israel Category:People from Baku Category:Soviet Jews Category:Soviet chess players Category:Sportswomen Category:20th-century Azerbaijani people Category:21st- century Azerbaijani people
title: Tatiana Zatulovskaya
